title: 13 DCs, 50 OCs reshuffled in Dhaka city
body: Thirteen deputy commissioners of the Dhaka Metropolitan Police and 50 officers-in-charge of police stations under the DMP were reshuffled on Thursday. The transfers of the police officers within the city were made through two separate notices signed by DMP commissioner SM Sazzat Ali, before the national election slated for the first half of February 2026. Several senior officials of the police and home ministry said that the reshuffle was made through a lottery on the same day. Shahriar Ali becomes DMPâ€™s DC for Uttara division while Mainul Haque for Mirpur division, Rawank Alam for Gulshan division, Mohammad Harun Or Rashid for Motijheel division, Mallik Ahsan Uddin Sami for Wari division and Tarek Mahmud becomes DC for Lalbagh division, among others reshuffled DCs in the city. Moreover, 50 OCs of Shahbagh, Kalabagan, Gulshan, Dhanmondi, Banani, Paltan, Lalbagh, Badda, Mohammadpur, Ramna, New Market, Motijheel, Mirpur and other police stations were also reshuffled in a separate notice. The two notices said that the orders would be effective immediately. Earlier, on December 2, OCs for 527 police stations under non-metropolitan areas across the country were selected through a lottery and superintendents of police for all 64 districts were also appointed on November 26 through a lottery.
